alert.note: Alert for Blair; Clearfield; Northern Centre (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 5:52PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL CLEARFIELD...SOUTHWESTERN CENTRE AND BLAIR COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 551 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Clearfield to near Tyrone to Hollidaysburg. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Altoona, Clearfield, Hollidaysburg, Tyrone, Philipsburg, Woodland, Roaring Spring, Curwensville, Bald Eagle, Martinsburg, Lakemont, Bellwood, Claysburg, Hyde, Williamsburg, Duncansville, Osceola Mills, Tipton, Plymptonville and Chester Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central and central Pennsylvania.
